sections.description: Container directory for command-line application entry points.
sections.purpose: Organizes executable entry points for the godot-uml project. Currently contains the go-uml CLI application which provides a command-line interface for rendering, validating, and serving PlantUML diagrams. Follows Go project convention of separating CLI tooling from library code.
strengths: Clear separation of concerns between library (pkg, internal) and executables (cmd)
Scalable structure for adding additional CLI tools or applications
Houses the main entry point for the primary godot-uml command-line tool
weaknesses: Currently contains only one subdirectory (go-uml), minimal organizational value at present
May be underutilized if additional CLI tools are not planned
sections.test_coverage: No direct tests at cmd level; testing is handled at cmd/go-uml level which includes comprehensive unit and integration tests.
sections.dependencies: Internal: Depends on cmd/go-uml which in turn depends on pkg/gouml (rendering engine) and internal/server (HTTP server). External: Standard library for CLI execution.
sections.functionality: Serves as the container for all executable entry points. The go-uml application within provides four main commands: render (PlantUML to SVG), validate (syntax checking), serve (interactive HTTP editor), and version (build information).
sections.files: No files at top level. Contains subdirectory: cmd/go-uml (CLI application with main.go and main_test.go).
